metadata.title: e-Appendix 1. List of hospitals reporting cases

body_text.text: A 63-year-old male with a history of cardiac arrhythmia developed a dry cough and chest tightness, and a fever (peak temperature: 38.7℃) since January 15. He was admitted to hospital by walking without oxygen on January 17 and received the treatments of anti-infection, anti-virus(oseltamivir), methylprednisolone, gamma globulin and oxygen therapy. Since January 23, the patient complained unbearable dyspnea even with the high flow nasal cannula. On January 25, he was transferred to the ICU and then received endotracheal intubation and ventilator-assisted breathing therapy on January 27. However, the patient's hypoxaemia remained unresolved even treated with ECMO. On January 28, the eleventh day of admission, the patient died of respiratory failure and septic shock.
January 22, chest CT: Bilateral ground glass opacity and flocculent shadows were observed, mainly located nearby the pleura.
January 27, chest X-rays: The brightness of lungs were decreased and diffuse patchy shadows were observed. Tracheal incubation was seen in the trachea

TABREF0.text: Clinical characteristics of 1590 patients with 2019-nCoV Data are presented as medians (ranges) and n/N (%). Abbreviations: COPD: chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, NIV: noninvasive ventilation, IMV: invasive mechanical ventilation, ECMO: extracorporeal membrane oxygenation, CRRT: continuous renal replacement therapy.e-Table 2.
